author: Iboyaima Laithangbam
text:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday called up the Chief Ministers of the affected northeastern States following the 6.7 earthquake that shook the entire region. Union Minister of State for Home Kiren Rijiju, who was in Arunachal Pradesh, rushed to Imphal, capital of Manipur, the epicentre of the quake, in the evening. Manipur Chief Minister Okram Ibobi described it as the worst earthquake to hit the State and announced a compensation of Rs. 5 lakh for the deceased.

While one of the NDRF teams moved to Noney, the other was stationed in the State capital “to facilitate relief work in other affected districts,” the Chief Minister said.

In the capital Imphal, the Minuthong bridge linking the east and west districts was damaged, disrupting road connectivity. The traditional Ema Keithel (Women’s Market) was also severely damaged. Power supply was disrupted in many areas.

Despite the severe weather, people are spending the night in the open beside log fires as houses have collapsed and aftershocks continued through the day.

“Many are injured and houses have collapsed in Kabui Kjulen and Pongailong villages but none of the relief teams has reached these areas,” said Kanarjit Kangujam of Youth Disaster Response Team. Tremor was felt across eastern India and 12 people were injured in northern districts of West Bengal.
title: Rijiju rushes to Imphal; women’s market evacuated
